attributes.action: Provide mental health support for all parents of premature and sick babies in UK
attributes.background:
90,253 premature and sick babies were admitted to a neonatal unit in the UK. [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit, 2014 report]
Parents of these babies are 10 times more likely to suffer post-natal depression.
41% of neonatal units have no access to trained support; 30% no support at all.
attributes.additional_details:
Little Miracles UK are campaigning to see: 

(1) Funding/resources for mental health support for all neonatal units in the UK 
(2) Mental health screening for all parents of premature and sick babies. 
(3) A trained mental health worker e.g. a counsellor, assigned to all neonatal units 
(4) After leaving hospital; care and professional support for as long as it is needed 
(5) Provision for peer-to-peer support, or similar, for these parents

attributes.action: Stop The Human Rights Abuse: Suspend Diplomatic Relations with Cameroon
attributes.background:
Within the past few weeks, Cameroon police have been beating up protesters including Common Law Lawyers. Some civilians have died and many injured. 
Social media is awash with images of lawyers assaulted by security forces, their wigs and gowns confiscated

Stop this from becoming a genocide!
attributes.additional_details:
The protests,  began with Lawyers, teachers and spread to student bodies, are all against the systematic marginalisation of English-speaking Cameroonians. 
See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38078238 

See http://bareta.press/federalism-political-issue-pm-tells-lawyers/ 

THEIR DEMAND IS FOR A TWO-STATE FEDERATION WITH EQUAL AUTONOMY 

Please ask the UK to suspend diplomatic relations with Cameroon until it stops its crackdown on peaceful protesters and start listening to their demands

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory self-defence classes into UK secondary schools
attributes.background: I propose that the UK Government introduces mandatory self-defence classes, or a self-defence programme, into the Physical Education (P.E.) part of the curriculum in secondary schools to equip children with the skills they need to defend themselves against an attacker.
attributes.additional_details: Children of today are regularly facing the threat of assault in a range of scenarios from bullying within schools to street abductions. I feel it is incredibly important to start equipping children with key self-defence skills in order to defend themselves against an attack effectively – without putting themselves in further danger. UK self-defence law should be taught as part of any self-defence classes or programmes introduced into schools; to prevent self-defence being used inappropriately.

attributes.action: Amnesty from prosecution and questioning of British Forces Veterans
attributes.background: The questioning and subsequent charging of ex service personnel, needs to stop. These serviceman and women served their country in good faith under orders and within the 'rules of engagement'. We, ex and current service personnel won't stand by and watch good men and women hanged out to dry.

attributes.action: Accept more visas from Pakistan
attributes.background: People applying for Visa from Pakistan are being unfairly treated.  Figures obtained from UK Immigration & Visa office state that visa acceptance from Pakistan in 2015 was 46.9% & from India it was 89.2%.In 2016 up to September 30th the figure was 46.1% from Pakistan & 87% from India, highly unjust.

attributes.action: Repeal The Hunting Act
attributes.background: The hunting act is a poorly constructed and worded piece of legislation, time for repeal
attributes.additional_details: The hunting act is a poorly constructed and worded piece of legislation. Having been in place for over ten years now it has not saved a single fox; hare or deer, only subjected them to less humane methods of control. It is now time to revisit this subject and repeal this ill thought out piece of legislation

attributes.action: Abolish the exemptions that MPs have received from the Investigatory Powers Act.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Act 2016 has just been passed by Parliament. It introduces further surveillance powers for UK spies. Most of the stronger powers require a warrant which can be usually issued by a secretary of state. For MPs, however, the Prime Minister must approve the warrant.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2016/25/contents/enacted

http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/investigatory-powers-bill-a7447781.html

attributes.action: Grant 1 year post-study internship stay for international students.
attributes.background: Capacity of international students to develop their countries is limited due to lack of internship opportunities. Increasing post-study stay to 1 year which was reduced from 2 years to 4months in 2012, will benefit developing countries as international graduates can return with better experience.
attributes.additional_details:
International students contribute up to £14.2 billion to UK economy in 2015 (NUS, 2016) with majority coming from resource poor countries (www.hefce.com). 
In the face of ongoing global challenges,  developing future generations of leaders is crucial. 
This can be achieved by allowing international students in UK a stay up to 1 year post-study to seek internship placement and gained practical knowledge. Evidence has shown that on-the-job training provides better learning outcomes (Ellstrom,2014)

attributes.action: Ensure the Pfizer and Flynn Pharma CMA fines are used solely to improve NHS care
attributes.background: Pharmaceutical companies Pfizer and Flynn Pharma have been fined a total of £89.4m by the Competition and Marketing Authority for exploiting a monopoly position over the marketing of the epilepsy drug Epanutin. Their actions have cost the NHS an estimated £44m per year for the last 4 years.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of this scandal has been entirely born by the NHS, and if all the fines are returned to the NHS it will still fall short of the £176m extra the NHS has had to pay for this vital drug. Patients with epilepsy have been most affected, and so some of the money should be used to employ Epilepsy Nurses to improve epilepsy care. See https://binscombedoctorblog.wordpress.com/2012/10/06/the-marketing-of-epanutin-re-energising-a-product-for-an-underserved-population-or-big-pharma-behaving-badly/

attributes.action: UK wide referendum to get rid of all devolved parliaments.
attributes.background: The entire population of the UK should have a referendum to abolish devolved parliaments (national assemblies). In 2004 according to the daily telegraph it cost £650  million a year to run. It causes division and friction. We should have a choice to go back to one inclusive parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kingdom is made up of England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. Devolution essentially means the transfer of powers from the UK parliament in London to assemblies in Cardiff and Belfast, and the Scottish Parliament in Edinburgh.

A United Kingdom should be run from one location with equal representation from all parts.

Devolution is divisive and human nature will have each part constantly trying to grab more power and to fight the other parts.

attributes.action: Make Organ Donation compulsory in the U.K. unless an individual opts out.
attributes.background:
As of 2010, 24 European countries have some form of presumed consent (opt-out) system, with the most prominent and limited opt-out systems in Spain, Austria, and Belgium yielding high donor rates.

In the United Kingdom organ donation is voluntary and no consent is presumed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are over 7,000 people on the UK national transplant waiting list and, during the last financial year, over 1,300 people either died whilst on the waiting list or became too sick to receive a transplant. This is because, despite more than 500,000 people dying each year in the UK, fewer than 5,000 people die in circumstances where they can become a donor. 

If we can increase the amount of people by only 5% this will save lives each and every week in the UK.

attributes.action: Condemn UNESCO and suspend any Government funding

This resolution is inherently Anti-Semitic  We call on the Government to condemn the resolution and suspend payments to UNESCO until its charter revokes any further racist abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Jerusalem is mentioned 806 times in the Old Testament. The Temple Mount was the the site to which Abraham  took Isaac was the home to five Jewish Temples, and has been the focal point of Jewish prayers since. 
The Palestinians have a long history of abusing UN bodies in an attempt to deligitimise Jewish claims to The Holy Land. 
This latest resolution at UNESCO is not only Anti-Semitic in challenging the fundamental belief of Jews but also challenges the fundamental basis of  Christianity

attributes.background: England should be afforded the same democratic rights as Scotland by being offered a referendum on leaving the union.

I shouldn't have to question how I'm going to go onto the birth certificate I should just be able to go on it as should any other transman in our situation!

attributes.action: Amend spelling expectations for end of Key Stage 2 assessment
attributes.background: It is almost impossible for children with spelling difficulties to reach ‘the expected standard’ in writing.Two small concessions would make a big difference-removal of spelling from teacher assessment of writing and reporting on the outcomes of the spelling test,separate from grammar & punctuation.
attributes.additional_details: Contrary to what the Bew review of assessment recommended, anyone currently working in a primary school, or with any knowledge of the assessment expectations, will know that the system that we are working with does not ensure that ‘the achievement of all pupils with Special Educational Needs is appropriately recognised’. They will also know that the secure fit approach to teacher assessment does not enable writing composition to form the greater part of writing assessment.

attributes.action: Teach sign language (makaton) to primary school children & teachers

Teaching Makaton would mean children/adults would be able to communicate throughout their life making society more inclusive & less frustrating
attributes.additional_details: My daughter signs to communicate. When we go out and she tries to communicate, everyone always asks me 'what is she saying'. Knowing just yes & no in sign & to understand children/adults with disabilities would make such a difference. Without better communication many people are trapped in their world. If we are accepting of people with disabilities why are we not teaching all children sign language to enable communication for all https://www.makaton.org/aboutMakaton/

attributes.action: Stop new adopted pet owners from euthanizing them without a Rescue's knowledge
attributes.background: A potential adopter made enquiries to adopt Rexie, a golden retriever, from Safe Rescue, a dog rescue charity. After a homecheck, she collected Rexie on Sat, 11.02.17, initially staying in contact with the fosterer to say how well Rexie had settled in. On Monday Rexie was put to sleep for no reason.
attributes.additional_details: Rexie came to the UK after a hellish start in Romania. Although 14 years old, he was in good health. He had a painful limp due to an earlier break in his leg that had gone untreated. On his arrival in the UK, his new foster parent took him to her vet. It was decided to amputate his leg, after several assessments and x-rays, and Rexie came through this operation well. He adapted to his 3 legs and was able to lead a normal, enjoyable life. His new owner had him pts without the Rescue's knowledge.

attributes.action: Ensure Bill Of Rights affords as much protection for vegans as Human Rights Act.
attributes.background:
By protecting vegans from discrimination and bullying, the Human Rights Act makes it easier to stay vegan - indirectly reducing animal exploitation.

But leaving the EU, and replacing the Human Rights Act with a Bill Of Rights, puts such protection at risk.

More at http://veganrights.uk
attributes.additional_details:
If the UK remains a party to the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may have to rely on foreign courts (in Strasbourg) for protection.

But if the UK also withdraws from the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may not be protected at all.

So either way, it is vital that the Government's Bill of Rights, intended to replace the Human Rights Act, provides just as much protection.

We would also expect to see the same protection for all other groups currently protected by the Act.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the C of E to discriminate against gay non-celibate clergy
attributes.background: The Anglican Church insists that gay clergy with partners live a celibate life if they wish to continue working as priests or bishops. This is an unfair burden on gay clergy as well as being discriminatory within the 21st century workplace.

attributes.action: Investigate covert foreign interference in EU referendum and other UK elections.
attributes.background:
The CIA in the US and the BfV in Germany have both spoken of Russian attempts to manipulate elections. 
It is naive to think that the UK would somehow be exempt from or immune to such assaults. There are rumours that the EU referendum was similarly targeted, and future elections remain vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important that the full scale of any manipulation is known, so that trust in democracy in the UK is restored and any necessary precautions can be developed.

It is noteworthy that in the US/German cases, promoting a fear of immigrants has been a major tactic.

German BfV statement: (16 Nov 2016; Reuters) http://reut.rs/2gZS17j

US CIA/FBI statement: (16 Dec 2016; Washington Post) http://wapo.st/2h9yKg0

EU referendum: (14 Dec 2016; The Independent) http://ind.pn/2i2Jeh5

The survivor is left with a life sentence whilst the abuser is free to reoffend after a short prison sentence.

Regardless of the opinion some hold of him, as the President of the US he deserves the respect he showed the UK.

attributes.action: Stop a race to the bottom on corporation tax
attributes.background: The Conservative government has suggested that if we do not get sufficient access to the single market when the UK leaves the EU, the UK would be forced to lower corporate tax rates to attract business to Britain. This is not the future we want for our country.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that corporations should pay their fair share of tax to fund the infrastructure and public services we all depend on. We further believe that to achieve this, there must be cooperation between nation states on tax matters. 
 
We deplore any attempt to encourage tax competition and to foster a race to the bottom on corporate tax rates putting at risk the social investment that citizens rely on.
 
We call on the government to work cooperatively with our EU partners on harmonising corporate tax rates across Europe and to ensure that the main rate of UK corporation tax rate is returned to a minimum of 28%.

attributes.action: Fund Research into Fibromyalgia
attributes.background:
Fibromyalgia, also called fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS), is a long-term condition that causes pain all over the body.
At present there are no known causes or cure. 
Fibromyalgia can be an invisible illness. Please take 30 seconds to sign this petition.

attributes.action: Please help us stop the closure of Newham Acute Day Hospital.
attributes.background: Newham Acute Day Hospital has helped 1000s of people with mental health problems who are in crisis.  The hospital is a vital, life-saving alternative to inpatient admission.  Let's take a stand against NHS cuts at a time when mental health problems are at epidemic levels in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Source funding to complete the International Bomber Command Centre
attributes.background: The government is committed to donate £20M to a memorial to the Normandy Campaign from the Libor fund, which is considered a fitting tribute. We request a similar donation, estimated at £3m, be debated in Parliament to be made, to enable the new International Bomber Command Centre to be completed.
attributes.additional_details:
The International Bomber Command Centre (IBCC) is being created to provide a world-class facility to serve as a point for recognition, remembrance and reconciliation for Bomber Command. 
The project includes recording, preserving and relating the stories of all those involved with or impacted by Bomber Command during the Second World War.  Covering the contribution of the men and women from over 60 nations, at all levels, the project will bring to life not only the period of the War, but the fight to gain recognition and the work undertaken to rebuild Europe's cities

attributes.action: Keep trains running between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.background: Hertfordshire County Council calls on the Government to take action to accelerate the infrastructure works at Stevenage station, to enable Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) to run trains between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.additional_details:
GTR has proposed changes to its new timetable, which include a replacement shuttle bus service between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage from 2018. This has been blamed on delays to the construction of a fifth platform at Stevenage, which has been pushed back by Network Rail into its work programme for 2019-24.

The council calls on the Department for Transport to work with Network Rail to bring forward the implementation of the fifth platform and keep this important rail link in operation.

attributes.action: Prevent the local authority budget cuts affecting adult and children social care
attributes.background: Central Government are cutting budgets to local governments which then affect the most vulnerable of society; children and vulnerable adults. Providing social care to children and adults is a statutory obligation and therefore the cuts should not affect these services.
attributes.additional_details:
Furthermore, Central Government should provide more funding to local authorities in respect of Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards. There is an increase in responsibility following the decision in Cheshire West, and Birmingham (DOLS and Children). To cut funding from these areas when the need for such services is increasing, alongside statutory responsibilities increasing is totally irrational, unreasonable, unjustified and unfair.

Stop the cuts to social care!

attributes.action: Make School Allergy Action Groups Standard Practice for All Schools in the UK
attributes.background: Cases of Anaphylaxis are rising in the UK. Schools have a statutory duty of care to support children with medical conditions. Allergies can be life threatening. We believe every school should adopt good practice in the way of School Allergy Action Groups as soon as practically possible.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are still left to write their own health and safety policies including those relating to allergies within the school setting. Adopting good practice (such as advocated by Allergy UK) in setting up School Allergy Action Groups/SAAG will enable school staff, pupils, parents, governors and providers (e.g.caterers) to collaborate in ensuring school is as safe as possible for those affected by life threatening allergies. It will reduce risks, save time, money and potentially lives.

attributes.action: Help stop the suffering in Syria
